lines.text: I've got what I'm looking for and I'm gonna grab it while I've got the chance. A real man. There's nothing to talk about. It was different in San Diego - you were kind of cute in your uniform. You were full of laughs then. Well, you're all laughed out now.
I work on people - suspects. Play up to their strengths, pour it on their weaknesses. You know, I only know one way, one thing that breaks 'em wide open - tension.
He was a liquor salesman. Big car and big bankroll. He was...

lines.character: Man at Counter Trying to Pick Up Claire

lines.text: Where's the gun? Why don't you ask my wife? Barney Deager was her friend, not mine. She was at his house, not me. Why don't you ask her? Maybe she'll tell you that too. Go on, ask her!, ask her!, ask her!
Why don't you save that for the cops?
Let them come, I've got nothing to hide, I'll tell them the truth.

Fine, fine - and what's the truth? Tell that you hated Barney Deager? To tell 'em that you hated Barney Deager so much you could have killed him? Why don't you tell 'em that he kicked you off the place? That he beat ya up? Tell 'em that he stole your wife.
I'm Collier Bonnabel. I'm a cop. I'm a Lieutenant Detective in, uh, Homicide. That's a fancy name for murder.

[approaching Bonnabel in a bar]
Lieutenant, what are you working on?
You're talking to me, Claire. That's like talking to an old friend. I know you from way back.
So - I got a file on you goes back further than you'd like to remember and up to where you wish you could forget.
